comment._content:
There´s a picture that I sent to Helena Zinkham through her hotmail (hope it reached her), that was most likely taken on April 2, 1913, at the arrival to Torreón of Gen. Ignacio A. Brarvo.  In that picture are seen, to the left of Gen. Bravo a slim officer that resembles a lot to that on horseback, and to his left a fat officer that resembles the one standing before the troops.  
If the above mentioned is correct that would change history about this and other pictures entitled as "Federals at Torreón".   And might tell when the División del Nazas (federals) arrived to Torreón on that date.
You as experts analysing historical pictures might help in establishing the correct historical background of these pictures.
